intro: Ecbolium latiflorum, commonly known as the broad-flower ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ecbolium latiflorum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats.
